text:
hey, I have 2 simple yet critical questions: 
1) Each jenkins build runs in its own container, right? 
2) Are some directories mounted and somehow shared between different instances?
1 no, we use VMs once, not containers - unless the build itself uses containers
Each build has it own VM?
2 not for minions, they're deleted after one use
It is possible that two build run on one minion (vm) under high load but rare
Minion is a more PC name for build slaves
so there is no chance that 2 builds somehow share a FS, right?
Think of the movie, uh, Minions :blush::blush:
under times ofhigh load - if the build queue exceeds 25 (iirc, maybe 32) it is possible that a minion would be reused, but so far that has been rare
I have a fix for that to ensure every minion is used once and only once but it would require a short outage to implement, so I'm waiting to roll up a bunch of infra needs before doing that
I see. Thanks for the clarification.
do you have a specific build you could point me to?
He told me today that he suspects something but I wanted to make sure
I think <@U1HFNJB50>, <@U0KPFAZNF> and I are having that conversation in DM :slightly_smiling_face:
